name: Poinsettia
description: Vibrant red leaves brighten winter days. Keep in bright light and avoid cold drafts.
funFact: Poinsettias are named after Joel Poinsett, the first U.S. ambassador to Mexico, who introduced them to the U.S. in the 1820s.
careTip: Water only when the soil feels dry to the touch to prevent root rot.
symbolism: Represents holiday cheer and celebration in many cultures.

name: Sunflower
description: Bold and cheerful, sunflowers thrive in full sun with well-drained soil.
funFact: Sunflowers can grow up to 12 feet tall and their heads follow the sun's movement, a behavior called heliotropism.
careTip: Stake tall sunflowers to prevent them from toppling in strong winds.

name: Chrysanthemum
description: Colorful blooms perfect for autumn. Water moderately and keep in cool temperatures.
funFact: Chrysanthemums are one of the birth flowers for November and symbolize longevity in some cultures.
careTip: Pinch back young plants in early summer to encourage bushier growth.

name: Tulip
description: Classic spring flowers that prefer well-drained soil and plenty of sunlight.
funFact: In the 17th century, tulip bulbs in the Netherlands were so valuable they caused an economic bubble called 'Tulip Mania.'
careTip: Plant bulbs 6-8 inches deep in fall for vibrant spring blooms.

name: Lavender
description: Fragrant and soothing, lavender thrives in full sun and dry, rocky soil.
funFact: Lavender oil has been used for centuries as a natural remedy for stress and insomnia.
careTip: Prune annually after flowering to maintain a compact shape.

name: Amaryllis
description: Striking flowers bloom indoors during the cold months. Keep soil lightly moist.
funFact: Amaryllis bulbs can bloom for decades if properly cared for, making them a holiday heirloom.
careTip: Rotate the pot regularly to ensure even growth toward light.

name: Marigold
description: Bright blooms that deter pests. Prefers sunny locations and regular watering.
funFact: Marigolds are often used in companion planting to protect vegetables from pests like nematodes.
careTip: Deadhead spent flowers to encourage continuous blooming.

name: Cyclamen
description: Delicate flowers in cool seasons. Avoid overwatering and direct sunlight.
funFact: Cyclamen flowers nod downward, earning them the nickname 'shooting stars' in some regions.
careTip: Place in a cool room (50-60Â°F) to extend blooming time.

name: Daffodil
description: Early bloomers that signal the arrival of spring. Plant bulbs in autumn.
funFact: Daffodils contain a toxic compound that makes them deer and rodent-resistant.
careTip: Allow foliage to die back naturally after blooming to nourish the bulb.

name: Zinnia
description: Low-maintenance flowers with bold colors. Attracts butterflies.
funFact: Zinnias were once considered so unremarkable they were called 'everybody's flower' in Victorian times.
careTip: Sow seeds directly in the garden after the last frost for best results.
